Sentece: The elimination half-life of high polar metabolites pool of quinidine (t1/2 beta = 6.1 h) has been determined in a quinidine phenobarbiturate intoxicated patient after the complete elimination of quinidine (its precursor) from blood.
Title: Elimination kinetic of high polar metabolites pool of quinidine from human serum.
Name: Quinidine barbiturate

Sentece: It is equivalent to the generally accepted t1/2 beta of quinidine (6.1 +/- 1.8 h) but substantially different from the t1/2 beta "hybrid" of 3-hydroxyquinidine (10.0 h) determined in therapeutic conditions in which 3-hydroxyquinidine coexists with quinidine in blood.
Title: Elimination kinetic of high polar metabolites pool of quinidine from human serum.
Name: Quinidine barbiturate

Sentece: It is equivalent to the generally accepted t1/2 beta of quinidine (6.1 +/- 1.8 h) but substantially different from the t1/2 beta "hybrid" of 3-hydroxyquinidine (10.0 h) determined in therapeutic conditions in which 3-hydroxyquinidine coexists with quinidine in blood.
Title: Elimination kinetic of high polar metabolites pool of quinidine from human serum.
Name: Quinidine barbiturate

Sentece: After PB pretreatment plasma quinidine concentrations at the end of a 10 hr infusion increased about twofold while the half-life decreased from a control value of about 16 hr to 6 hr.
Title: Induction of quinidine metabolism and plasma protein binding by phenobarbital in dogs.
Name: Quinidine barbiturate

Sentece: After PB pretreatment plasma quinidine concentrations at the end of a 10 hr infusion increased about twofold while the half-life decreased from a control value of about 16 hr to 6 hr.
Title: Induction of quinidine metabolism and plasma protein binding by phenobarbital in dogs.
Name: Quinidine barbiturate

Sentece: Pharmacokinetic analysis of the data showed a decrease in steady-state volume of distribution (Vdss) of quinidine from an average value of 153 L to 54 L after PB treatment, while the total clearance did not change (6.6 vs. 5.6 L/hr).
Title: Induction of quinidine metabolism and plasma protein binding by phenobarbital in dogs.
Name: Quinidine barbiturate
